Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: SBolshakov
Reviews.Content: All in all - standard business hotel. Two major issues during the stay: 1. Restaurant is not working in July-Augest, although we managed to find some places to eat nearby. 2. They need to fix air conditioning in the rooms. Most of the time it was almost non working.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Aman J
Reviews.Content: So we arrived today at 2 o'clock and from the outside the hotel looks pretty stylish. However, having now settled in the experience has gone downhill. The surrounding area of the hotel is unexciting and the metro station is a fair distance from the center of town - according to the receptionist a 45 minute journey. As we only just landed we felt like relaxing and exploring the amenities in the hotel of which there are very little. The restaurant is closed which after reading other reviews seems to be a common occurrence and the our conservatory is more of a gym then the "health club" that has been advertised. The room is warm and comfortable but the walls are covered in markings and a lack of cleaning has left the room full of dust. Turn up with no expectations and you'll be pleasantly surprised - otherwise if you are looking for a hotel with a variety of amenities and activities within the hotel than this is not the one. All in all 4* is a massive exaggeration and 2* would not be unfair.

Reviews.Title: “OK....”
Reviews.Author: 5ContinentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the High Tech for 1 night while on business trip. Very close to Vodafone and Telefonica. Receptionist was friendly, helpful and also helped to flag a taxi taking credit card.

Reviews.Title: “superior customer service”
Reviews.Author: soundwords
Reviews.Content: Pleasant and clean accommodations with more than the usual complimentary sample size items. Free wi-fi with laptop size tablet pre-installed in the room. The beds were the most comfortable of our 3 week vacation. Desk service was very gracious and helpful. Although the hotel was farther from the city than we'd anticipated their free shuttle service brought and picked us up at the train which was a 15 minute ride into Plaza Sol/Plaza Mayor. The breakfast was an amazing buffet with items for all tastes, including fresh fruit and wrapped muffins and cakes, if the traveler did not have time for a sit down meal. The evening meal at the bar was very good - recommend the grilled veal or the hamburger. The surroundings outside the hotel have no attraction, but the accomodations were very nice and it was a surprisingly pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: JamboSpraoi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel despite the reviews, as I was doing business in the area and would be there for only one night. I decided I could put up with a less than stellar hotel for the night. There were no surprises on arrival to be honest. The check-in staff were very welcoming, friendly and courteous. The lobby of the hotel was perfectly acceptable. The room however is very dated and in need of updating and also showing lots of signs of wear and tear. The other major point is that this is a ghost town. The entire area seems to be a bit of a ghost estate, a relic of the spanish property boom. I did find one really good restaurant near the Las Tablas Metro stop. Restaurant Muus was great and I will write a full review when it is added. Having read the comments about the breakfast and learning that it would cost 9 euro I declined it, instead I ate a coffee and a pastry at my clients canteen for EUR 1.95. I'm sure there are other good deals in cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Nada_K_R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during my3 -day business trip. From my perspective very good hotel for business stay. Reasonably sized rooms and very comfortable bed. Nice and clean bathroom. I did not spend much time in the room, but when I was there I was able to do some work there. No distractions at all. Breakfast was good, the breakfast room might need some more decoration, but still ok. I was even offered transportation to the airport for free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel is the location suits you”
Reviews.Author: Gorkus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the outskirts of Madrid, near IFEMA. Rooms are spacious, breakfast is rather good and you can get transportation from the airport (although you might have to wait a little bit as the same shuttle runs to the airport and IFEMA). The area where the hotel is, is an Industrial Park with not much social life offer. You can go for a run to a nearby park and grab a bite to eat somewhere in the neighbourhood, however that is about it. The hotel offers complimentary wi-fi. Nice one. If the location suits you, this hotel will not dissapoint you at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awful every step of the way. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: lambouk
Reviews.Content: Billed my credit card 4 times before arrival. Hotel over booked and got a call from them 4 hours before due to arrive to advise we'd have to stay elsewhere (another equally awful High Tech hotel). The room might have been high tech 10th years ago. The presence of an exercise bike did nothing for me. The lack of an iron was annoying, and the one borrowed from reception a health hazard (broken cord, leaking water). The discount promised on the phone call about the over booking was not known about once arriving here. Avoid this hotel, and this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, nice bathroom, middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Janakii
Reviews.Content: This felt very much like a business hotel. Check-in was quick, room large with a suitably large bathroom (great power shower, no bath). Modern in style, free decent wi-fi, large bed. Telly was mostly Spanish (in fact I don't remember finding an English speaking channel). Breakfast was standard fare, rather a lack-lustre choice of rubbery scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, toast. A selection of a few cheese slices and cold meats. Biggest criticism is that it is in the middle of nowhere- about 30-45 min by train or taxi into the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special; bit under average”
Reviews.Author: PopeyeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: had to stay for one night. totally average hotel, in fact a bit under average. the floor of the entire room is cheap parquet which, barefoot, feels slightly cold/unclean. the bed was also too small. other than that nothing much to say about this except that it is located near the middle of nowhere and the breakfast is not great--except for the coffee since they have reasonably good cappuccino. having said all this the check-in was friendly and for the rest I did not see any personnel. there is no reason to stay in this hotel unless you have to

Reviews.Title: “Not very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: NMMc
Reviews.Content: We had trouble with our booking with the hotel- we booked online with allresnet and had a good rate of 70 Euros for a family room (2 bunk beds and a double). When we arrived they claimed we had a reservation for only 2 people and that it wasn't for a family room. Thankfully I had kept my voucher/receipt and the front desk sorted it out (grudgingly- we had a brief argument). On check out, they charged me 100 Euros- and again I had to show my receipt for my reservation. So it was one battle after another. Luckily we were there for only one night. The rooms are fine-clean with a laptop and internet service, but nothing special. The small cafe is saturated with cigarette smoke. The food in the dining room was good- but no vegetarian main course option. There is free airport shuttle but you have to call to let them know you are arriving. Taxis are just outside the main entrance. The front desk supplied metro maps and maps of central Madrid (but you have to ask for them). Overall our booking experience and how it was handled set the tone for our visit and it wasn't very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Subpar Bed”
Reviews.Author: cfiroy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for both business and pleasure. The breakfast was better than average and the staff was friendly and helpful. Only one TV channel had English programming and only for a few hours per day. The most memorable part was the bed. Rock hard and never got used to it even after seven days. Normally it takes me only two or three days to adjust to a hard bed but this one was an exception. I never woke up without being sore.

Reviews.Title: “good location, modern hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: wgafster09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel. It has a very modern design and trendy concept and is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: AmolJ2
Reviews.Content: nice amenities. a little away from central city but in business district....so you need to move around a lot on weekends...avarage continental breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with great bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: The High Tech is a very good hotel in the business district of Madrid but only 10 minutes from the hustle and bustle of the Chueca. A modern hotel, the real high points are the rooms, very trendy with flat screen tv's and ipod docks and laptop computers. Bathrooms are 'in' the rooms with glass walls but with sliding screens should you want privacy. Comfortable beds with great toiletries. Because of the location it's quiet at night so no problem with crowds of revellers carousing past in the early hours.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: GodisGoood
Reviews.Content: the airport shuttle is free (ARRANGE BEFORE YOU ARRIVE WITH THE HOTEL!) the beds are comfy. the room is modern and clean. there is a free computer in the room for the internet. there is a 10min walk to the metro. we were in madrid 2 days and this was great for us. we paid $87 through hotels.com. the front desk was rude but that was at everyhotel we stayed at in spain

Reviews.Title: “Really good for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Krisita
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed in this hotel last July on a business trip, (Vodafone and Telecinco are just 5 minutes away) and I can say that the hotel is absolutely great. I've stayed in 5 stars hotels, but this one has more things to offer. The room was big, there was a laptop in the bedroom (but if you can you can use the cable to access with your own), a LCD screen and the bathroom even had a cabin of hydromassage. The hotel is located in a very quiet neighborhood, but there are plenty of good restaurants near by. The metro station is about 600m away. The breakfast also has plenty of variety and the food is great. The staff is really very friendly, and there is even a free shuttle service to the airport. Although I recommend it for business trips, for tourism is very far away from Madrid: from the metro station to Puertas del Sol, you take at least 40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABRH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business for 2 nights in May. The rooms are a good size and very well furnished. Bathrooms are spacious and very futuristic. As with the rest of the hotel, the rooms are kept very clean. As others have commented, facilities include a large flatscreen TV, and laptop in every room - you may need to get a log-on from reception, but access is free. The hotel restaurant is open in the evening, but the choice of dishes is limited - although prices for a hotel were reasonable. Although this is a business district, there are some good local restaurants within 5 minutes walk. I found breakfast excellent, with a tremendous choice of fresh items (cold and hot). My one complaint was the rooms air-conditioning. Despite checking the settings, there was no way I could get the room down to a comfy temperature. Overall, this is an excellent good value hotel. It was recommended to me by colleagues, all of whom have found it a reliable choice. It is do-able as a hotel for leisure travellers, but be warned that you will have a bit of a journey into the central tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dkipping
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with my stay at this hotel; my family and I had booked for a long weekend and were v.impressed with both the location of the hotel and the internal decor (as well as the price of the stay may I add). It is very modern, v.clean and the rooms are of a good size. A few things on the downside - the walls are paper thin, the ladder on the bunkbeds was a tad unstable so no good for boisterous young children (say, under 6) and, for a family, there is not enough storage. On the plus, the staff were very efficient, the free internet access is a plus along with the satellite access on the tv (sad, but true)! I must add though, contrary to the hotel's details, the hotel is not 5 minutes by car from the airport, more like 20 minutes and that was with a clear road, and the free shuttle - which was excellent especially when you have a 6am pick-up time - only picks up/drops off at the airport, nowhere else. The metro station is about a 5-10 minute walk - good - and there are a few restaurants about 3 minutes walk away - which you wouldn't know if you didn't ask! There are about 4 playgrounds right in front of the hotel which is great for young children and a bonus after you've done a day's walking round the sites of Madrid for the children to wind down before retiring back to your room. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lacking in certain areas”
Reviews.Author: indiamilan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel when it was fairly new in Apr 2006. Let me start by saying that the service was excellent and the rooms are exactly as they look online. The contemporary design is fabulous. The location on the other hand left a lot to be desired because it was so far off from everything else. My boyfriend and I were there for 2 weeks and we spent a fortune on cabs! Also the beds were terribly hard (personally) on my back. After about 3 days there I was plagued with terrible back pain. I ended up requesting more pillows and spreading them on the bed and sleeping on them every night to ease the discomfort. My overall stay was just average and I personally wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone else but to each his/her own. The bed was probably perfect to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: maociu
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the High Tech Nueva Castellana on a business trip and would recommend the place only for that purpose, as it is located in the business area far away from Madrid's centre. The bedroom is big, with a comfy bed, nice colors and design. The high tech can be summarized in a flat screen tv and a laptop. The buffet breakfast was ok. Perhaps too dark for my taste, especially when it's dark outside as well. Complaints: - neither slippers nor bathrobe available in the room - no bath towel, but just small ones - music in the corridor till late in the night - thin walls not preventing the loud volume of the neighbour's tv from bothering. For the full price, I would be a bit disappointed, but having found a special offer, all in all I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwilsoa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the business district. They do have a shuttle to the airport but you need to sign up for time slots. You can take a cab to the main area of Madrid. The estimated cost of doing so is 20Euros. The staff was accommodating. There is no clock or alarm in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, watch out for bargains”
Reviews.Author: Dimitrakis
Reviews.Content: That hotel was a surprise for us. We booked it for only one day, as it was the start of our Spain tour, but we should have stayed there for more time. The most modern style I've ever experienced in a hotel, with dark colours captivating your view. One laptop in every room, flat screen tv, hydromassage, and a stylish bathroom, brings you to another decade. The only bad thing was that due to the style adopted, the bathroom is separated only by glass from the rest of the room, so everyone in the room can hear anything coming from the bathroom. This hotel is in a purely business area. We arrived there on Sunday afternoon and it was like a dead city: lots of big empty buildings, no car in the streets. The very next day, everything changed to its busy aspect. Must no1: you should have rented a car, or pay a lot in taxis (we rented a car). it's very far from the center. Must no.2: you should have a gps or a very good map, it's easy to get lost in this area and not being able to find even one man to ask. FINALLY: if you have a car, you must experience this hotel TIP: Book it for the weekend. We did so and booked for 60 euros a day. On weekdays the rates reach 160 euros!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but out of town”
Reviews.Author: newbury2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while on business in Madrid. The hotel is located on the edge of the city about 15 mins from the airport and near to a local business and residential district. The rooms were clean and offered a modern look and feel with everything coming across as "new". Although the bar and restarant were quite small, the service was excellent and the food most agreeable. I'd recommend this hotel if your travelling to Madrid on business. If visiting as a tourist then you would probably prefer someting closer to the centre. NOTE: As hotel is new and in a relatively new-built district, taxi drivers are not always sure where it is so make sure you have the address of the hotel with you!

Reviews.Title: “beautifull and clean”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean...I spendt only one night at this hotel but i enjoyed it...Two great things about this hotel...#1 free shuttle from the airport and #2 free internet... This hotel is located in an industrial area so there's not much thing to see or do around,but the shuttle can take you to the center of madrid... The staff was nice and nothing was complicated...

HotelInfo.Name: High Tech Nueva Castellana
HotelInfo.Address: Maria Tubau 16 | Fuencarral, 28050 Madrid, Spain
